channel.title: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.
channel.description:
In the United States, a new law proposal called The Combating Online Infringement and Counterfeits Act (COICA) was introduced last week, and there will be a hearing in front of the Judiciary Committee this Thursday.
If passed, this law will allow the government, under the command of the media copanies, to censor the internet as they see fit, like China and Iran do, with the difference that the sites they decide to censor will be completely removed from the internet and not just in the US.
Please see the following article from the Huffington Post for more information.
More info: [url]https://www.huffingtonpost.com/david-segal/stop-the-internet-blackli_b_739836.html[/url]
Sign the petition: [url]https://demandprogress.org/blacklist/[/url]

item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
If I understand it correctly this law makes it easier for them to take down such content. Now, rather than having to contact the host of the website and get a warrant for the creator’s arrest etc. etc. they can just DDoS it with their super computers.

I just gathered that from this thread, though, and even this thread has tons of bullshit so i could be wrong

item.source: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.

item.title: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.
item.dc:creator: Jaycee
item.description:
So here’s something I don’t think anyone has asked yet:

If the bill will only effect american-based websites, and it only effects sites that are infringing copyright laws and similar, why the hell does this law need to pass? Copyright laws already exist, else I wouldn’t be talking about them.

It just sounds to me like a pointless law because it already exists, just not directly regarding the internet. If there is enough evidence to envoke this new law then there’s surely already enough to take the website down and prosecute the owners the old fashioned way?!

Read full topic
item.source: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.

item.title: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.
item.dc:creator: Shinobi
item.description:
DinoThrasher:

So many things wrong here, where to start…

YouTube seems like such a bad example for this. While yes it has some pirated material on it, it makes a pretty good effort to keep this content off. I’ve had more and more trouble finding such content on YouTube over time. Also, the owners of YouTube are not actually supporting piracy. I doubt something as big as YouTube is going to be easily shut down when it’s doing it’s best to remove pirated material and clearly does not support pirated material.

How could they take down Blogs critical of the government? Unless they slip that in somewhere in the bound to be overly long bill, the ACTUAL bill does not give them that power. It is clearly written that it is targeting copyright infringement and piracy. Blogs critical to the government break no laws or constitutional rights even remotely related to copyright or piracy law.

Finally, the US government does not have absolute power, that quote is totally out of context. There are 100 senators, 435 representatives, 1 president, and 9 supreme court justices to go through. That’s 545 people viewing this bill, 535 of which have some control over the content of it. That’s not even close to absolute power.

Besides the fact that Youtube is owned by Google, and I’m not sure but I think even the US government wouldn’t want to mess with such a beast.

Read full topic
item.source: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.

item.title: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
JeffMOD:

I hope that everyone realizes sites such as Youtube would be blacklisted. I mean, it’s full of “Pirated” songs, right?
It doesn’t matter if Fair Use laws allow it, if it contains ANY copyrighted material, Youtube is going down- Just like WMG has been doing to the videos on it for years.
Not to mention any Blog critical of the Government, and god knows what else.

This is bad news, guys. I just want those of you who don’t see that to understand the gravity of the situation. Absolute power corrupts absolutely, and power over what can be seen on the internet is absolute power over it.

So many things wrong here, where to start…

YouTube seems like such a bad example for this. While yes it has some pirated material on it, it makes a pretty good effort to keep this content off. I’ve had more and more trouble finding such content on YouTube over time. Also, the owners of YouTube are not actually supporting piracy. I doubt something as big as YouTube is going to be easily shut down when it’s doing it’s best to remove pirated material and clearly does not support pirated material.

How could they take down Blogs critical of the government? Unless they slip that in somewhere in the bound to be overly long bill, the ACTUAL bill does not give them that power. It is clearly written that it is targeting copyright infringement and piracy. Blogs critical to the government break no laws or constitutional rights even remotely related to copyright or piracy law.

Finally, the US government does not have absolute power, that quote is totally out of context. There are 100 senators, 435 representatives, 1 president, and 9 supreme court justices to go through. That’s 545 people viewing this bill, 535 of which have some control over the content of it. That’s not even close to absolute power.

Read full topic

item.title: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
av3nger:

What are you even talking about? I don’t watch the news.

We can tell.

av3nger:

Corruption can spread anywhere in any way shape or form that I can think of. Just depends on the people you are surrounding yourself with. For all we know Obama probably hasn’t even given his birth papers. Trust him? No I don’t.

His birth papers? See, that’s exactly the blind ignorance and fear he was talking about. The president doesn’t have time to address every ridiculous (and clearly xenophobic) accusation thrown at him by wingnuts, especially ones that are continually thrown out by the courts.

And again, that you’re dragging Obama into this makes no sense. The president doesn’t pass laws, he can only veto them or sign them into law. This issue only has to do with congress. Even if Obama were the most corrupt person in the world, it would have no bearing on this bill whatsoever.

Read full topic
item.source: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.

item.title: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.
item.dc:creator: av3nger
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

Blind fear, ignorance, exaggeration, shall I go on with what else is wrong with this statement?

Seriously, has the media trained you so hard as to freak out about things you don’t understand that you do it without thought. Come on! regulation of Internet websites turning into concentration camps? You sound like a ten year old regurgitating the beliefs and fears of his ignorant mommy and daddy.

Seriously this statement is exactly whats wrong with how people interpret news.

Edit: Also I find it amusing how you jump to blame Obama despite this piece of legislation coming from congress.

What are you even talking about? I don’t watch the news.

Corruption can spread anywhere in any way shape or form that I can think of. Just depends on the people you are surrounding yourself with. For all we know Obama probably hasn’t even given his birth papers. Trust him? No I don’t.

-DP-

Read full topic

item.title: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.
item.dc:creator: av3nger
item.description:
Burbinator:

Yeah, that’s pretty bad. They should fine or arrest the owner of the site and/or have the owner shut it down. Alternatively they could have the owner of the server take it down. That’s the only way I can think of for this to be acceptable.

OR, we could just say fuck you and stop succumbing.

Read full topic

item.title: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.
item.dc:creator: Moonpooman
item.description:
X_Mastershot_X:

NOOOO! ‘Mericans don’ tuch mah Pirate Bay!

The Bill only allows the American Government to censor sites located in the USA, while The Pirate Bay servers used to be located in Sweden, but is now located somewhere else.
The reason I am being so unspecific about their current location is because nobody knows.
They could be anywhere!

They could even be right behind you…

item.description:
JeffMOD:

I hope that everyone realizes sites such as Youtube would be blacklisted. I mean, it’s full of “Pirated” songs, right?
It doesn’t matter if Fair Use laws allow it, if it contains ANY copyrighted material, Youtube is going down- Just like WMG has been doing to the videos on it for years.
Not to mention any Blog critical of the Government, and god knows what else.

This is bad news, guys. I just want those of you who don’t see that to understand the gravity of the situation. Absolute power corrupts absolutely, and power over what can be seen on the internet is absolute power over it.

I already posted a direct quote from the bill that proves this wrong. It has to be shown that the main purpose of the website is the distribution of pirated material to get it shut down. Don’t give me that crap about not seeing the “gravity” of the situation, please.

This isn’t anything to be worried about.

Worst case scenario is /b/ DDoSes the government servers x10 harder than the government servers DDoS any other site, and the government abandons it for being too costly.

Censoring the internet is one of the most pointless things anyone could attempt.

item.dc:creator: Shinobi
item.description:
Burbinator:

So, how exactly are they going to “shut down” offending websites? That’s pretty critical to the quality of the bill.

Exactly. They don’t shut down the site, they just block us from seeing it. That’s the problem I have with this law.

item.title: Stop the Internet Blacklist. Sign the petition.
item.dc:creator: av3nger
item.description:
Shinobi:

The thing about this rule that I don’t like is the approach they are taking to solving the problem. I fine and all with shutting down illegal websites, but that’s not what they are doing. They are not disabling the site, they are blocking people from it. So they aren’t attacking the site, they are attacking the people. Idk I’m just thinking out loud here. I guess I’m gonna go with DinoThrasher here, censor is the wrong word.

Yeah, what ever happened to “Expressing ourselves”.

Damn Obugger.

Read full topic
